results.name: A triangle formed like Pascal's triangle, but with 4^n on the borders instead of 1.
comment: All rows except the zeroth are divisible by 4. Is there a closed-form formula for these numbers, like for binomial coefficients?
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n = 0..50 of triangle, flattened
mathematica: t = {}; Do[r = {}; Do[If[k == 0 || k == n, m = 4^n, m = t[[n, k]] + t[[n, k + 1]]]; r = AppendTo[r, m], {k, 0, n}]; AppendTo[t, r], {n, 0, 10}]; t = Flatten[t]
xref: Cf. A007318 (Pascal's triangle), A228053 ((-1)^n on the borders).
Cf. A051601 (n on the borders), A137688 (2^n on borders).
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Aug 06 2013
